subject: Re: Possible bug with @Ignore @BeforeClass?
msgSnippet: ... Maybe it is a bug, But I think it is your understanding is wrong. @BeforeClass is like the junit3 TestSetup class. @Before is like setUp you should use
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Mike Morris" <mikro2nd@...> wrote:
>
> ...or am I not understanding something?
>
> Tried @Ignoring an @BeforeClass method, but it doesn't get ignored.
> Bug in the runner or in my understanding?
>

Maybe it is a bug, But I think it is your understanding is wrong.
@BeforeClass is like the junit3 TestSetup class.
@Before is like setUp
you should use @Ignoring to a @Test annotation.
In eclipse when you use @Ignoring to a @Test,the runner show
a slash icon before the test.
